text: The Florence Town Hall is located in the Town of Florence, Wisconsin. ==History== The building was constructed as a Works Progress Administration project. In addition to municipal operations, it housed an auditorium for special events. The building was added to the State Register of Historic Places in 2013 and to the National Register of Historic Places the following year. ==References== Category:City and town halls on the National Register of Historic Places in Wisconsin Category:National Register of Historic Places in Florence County, Wisconsin Category:Auditoriums in the United States Category:Works Progress Administration in Wisconsin Category:Streamline Moderne architecture in Wisconsin Category:Brick buildings and structures Category:Government buildings completed in 1937
title: Florence Town Hall, Wisconsin
